website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a treat that provides oral care benefits and don't mind the higher price, they are a good choice.
pros: Has a unique shape designed to help clean teeth and fight tartar buildup
Made of natural ingredients, and available in a variety of sizes and flavors
cons: They are on the costly side, and very small dogs may have a difficult time chewing them

customer_reviews.title: Did something change?
customer_reviews.text: My 28# cockapoo has eaten these for quite a while -- almost daily basis; loved them and no problems. A couple weeks ago when I received the latest order, he had a couple and started having (TMI alert) loose poops that progressed to looser with blood and mucous. I wondered about the Greenies, but couldn't rule out anything else. Then, last week, it happened again. Greenies was the only thing introduced back into his diet on a regular basis. Without them, his gut recovers and is OK. Has anyone else experienced this?
customer_reviews.author: Melodie

customer_reviews.title: Do. Not. Buy. These.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs are very healthy and have never had digestive issues. I have both dogs a Greenie the day the treats arrived, and both of them had black, tarry diarrhea within four hours. For about 24 hours, we were all miserable. I normally feed my pups rawhide treats and Bully sticks, and they've never had a problem with any treat before. I seldom give a bad review, but these treats deserve one.
customer_reviews.author: themightypen

customer_reviews.title: Beware: can cause serious sickness
customer_reviews.text: Made my dog very sick. She’s had diarrhea for 2 days. This is the only thing that could have caused it. I have thrown the whole package away. I will never purchase again. Not sure if the actual bones were expired or if it’s just the ingredients. My dog has eaten all sorts of bones and treats but nothing has made her this sick. Never ever again. Please beware.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B.

customer_reviews.title: the tooth cleaning benefits are great
customer_reviews.text: i used to give my GSD greenies rarely, just when she had dog breath from eating god knows what on her walk. they are expensive, and so i saw no reason to give them to her every day. but as she got older, her teeth became stained, and she rally hates it when i brush her teeth. i can do it, but it is always a struggle. so last year,i started giving her one greenie every day, and the stains have mostly disappeared from her teeth. an older dog's quality of life can be very much affected by tooth decay, so i am glad to have found that greenies work so well to clean her teeth.
customer_reviews.author: mvd

customer_reviews.title: They love them!
customer_reviews.text: I give Greenies to my 2 dogs every Saturday night after I wash the dishes. I don't know how they do it, but they seem to know when it's Saturday. They sit in the kitchen eagerly waiting for me to finish the dishes. When I'm done, I say to them "what's next?". They coax me upstairs to get their beloved Greenies. I guess they like them!
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Troyka

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves them... I question the value
customer_reviews.text: My dog really likes these.... But he still has dog breathe, and these things are awfully expensive. Sometimes it isn't horrible, but sometimes... I wonder what the heck we're buying these for, because his breathe is still pretty bad. I have them on subscribe & save.... but always find myself wondering if it's worth it. Keeping it at 4 stars, because my dog has a sensitive stomach that these don't upset and they are his favorite treat (the only food/treats we've found so far that don't give him diarrhea are Blue Buffalo Lamb and the Nutro crunchy treats and biscuits).
customer_reviews.author: E. Dean

customer_reviews.title: Buyer be aware!!, research online many sick dogs from this!!
customer_reviews.text: Check all the reviews online before you buy!!!!!!! My dog loves them but started vomiting everywhere the whole day, I gave him pepto bismol which always helps him within a couple of hours if he has an upset stomach. Not this time!! I was thinking what did he eat new and it was the Greenies!!! He is still lethargic and I had to syringe feed him water. I hope he’ll be better tomorrow or will have to take him to vet .
customer_reviews.author: schoenen

customer_reviews.title: Warning: easy to Swallow whole!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these but warning: he is a 40 lb terrier/lab. They are very slippery when eaten and he swallowed one that he bit in half twice. At first I was t sure what it was that he threw up as they are no longer green, white actually when thrown up. He dint chew them. He swallowed them! He got sick. And kept vomiting both times. He had done it previously even but I could not figure out what it was that he threw up. It’s too bad because he liked them and all the vets sell them. I think the contents are not good for dogs.
customer_reviews.author: am

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves Greenies, however, I wish they ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves Greenies, however, I wish they would last longer. She can finish one in under a minute. So, I don't know if it really aids in her dental health.
customer_reviews.author: Winthrop

customer_reviews.title: Eh...just ok
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these on Prime Day since they were an incredible price. I had not purchased them for awhile due to my displeasure with the quality from a few years ago. It would appear not much has changed and I see the same issues that drove me away. These are no longer a harder consistency but a much softer material than the original ones. They also don't smell very good and make me wonder what they actually do for my dogs breath. Greenies are a known brand that has unfortunately fallen over the past few years and no longer resemble the high quality product that justified the inflated price.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Goblin

customer_reviews.title: VET RECOMMENDED!
customer_reviews.text: After a severe dental issue with my Italian greyhound, my vet suggested these greenies on a daily basis to help with further dental issues. My dog is 11 years old and the breed is prone to dental issues. After a year of a giving him one of these greenies every morning- his teeth are no worse for wear. When I first introduced these to my dog- he really wasn't too thrilled about them. After basically making him realize he was getting no other treat that day until he ate a greenie every morning, he very quickly started gnawing them down. Now after a year- he anxiously awaits his morning greenie and seems disappointed if I give him something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Caused seizure in our Schnauzer
customer_reviews.text: My Schnauzer experienced a seizure after eating his Greenie. Went looking online and this is apparently a common occurrence for dogs to have seizures after consuming Greenies. Our poor pup was blind for a couple of minutes after the seizure. He is doing ok now, but we will never buy Greenies again.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Greenies are dog-approved products. Not sure how much they actually help dog teeth??
customer_reviews.text: Greenies are great. Of all the dog dental chews these are the most well known and some of the best available. My dogs alternate between these and some of the other dental chews that are available depending on the deals that are fine. They seem to enjoy these as much as they do the others. However, I do find that the greenies dental shoes tend to be larger then some of the other brands. As far as the deal on Amazon, this is a pretty good deal. I recommend them. I’m not sure if they help my dogs teeth but they do enjoy eating them.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Causes Extreme Digestive Issues
customer_reviews.text: Greenies product gave my boxer extreme digestive issues. Caused diarrhea and vomiting. Many other websites claimed similar issues from the Greenies brand product. All digestive issues subsided when we discounted these treats. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: My 10-month-old puppy has been enthusiastically eating one treat every day ever since he was only a few months old. During the last vet check-up I was told he had tartar and for a mere $200 they'd be happy to clean his teeth. Well, I am not spending over $30 every month on these dental treats if they cannot fulfill their primary purpose: prevent tartar build-up to help prevent further dental issues. I'll see if we get better results with other dental treats.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Causes stomach ache in dogs
customer_reviews.text: We were giving 1/2 biscuit to our 5 year old mixed breed dog daily. Our dog seemed to suffer stomach aches at least 2-4 times per month. He would not eat his morning meal and vet thought he may have had acid reflux. So he prescribed a acid reducer pill when our dog had symptoms. When we went to reorder Greenies for the umpteenth time, my husband started reading the negative reviews so then we wondered if the Greenies were causing the problem. So we ended the Greenies and low and behold he has not had an issue since!! There are more natural products on the market.
customer_reviews.author: BRIAN MAHER

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Our "baby" started with Greenies when his permanent teeth first came in and got one a day for the remainder of his almost 17 years. They were his favorite treat, only surpassed by a fresh steak bone. He never experienced bad breath or dental problems for the duration of his life. Never experienced tooth decay or tarter build up. He has passed now but I would highly recommend Greenies to any dog owner.
customer_reviews.author: 1nolaguy

customer_reviews.title: He loves them.
customer_reviews.text: My dog has become a junkie... like clockwork, at the same time everyday, I could set my watch by it... he starts to nuzzle me and then walk over and look up towards the cookie jar where we store his favorite treats. If he doesn’t get one he sulks and pouts... if I go into another room before he gets one, he stays between me and the greenie jar at all times, reminding me that he needs his fix becoming more and more panicked with every passing minute. He will do anything for one his greenies including letting me file his nails, clean his ears, clean his paws. I honestly think he’d sell me out for a fix of greenie.
customer_reviews.author: Dackll

customer_reviews.title: Caused Terrible Diarrhea in My Aussiedoodle
customer_reviews.text: My Aussiedoodle has had diarrhea two days in a row after eating these. I hope he is better by tomorrow. I won't give him anymore. I wish I never bough these. I want a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Mommy

customer_reviews.title: My mistake
customer_reviews.text: I have been using greenies for our Manchester Terrier for some time. This was the first time purchasing from Amazon. All was great - price, delivery, packaging for shipment, product quality. So why did I give such a mediocre rating? I foolishly ordered the wrong size. That was certainly my fault but I do think that the description could have been a little clearer or the size to order. BUT I ABSOLUTELY RECOMMEND GREENIES AND THEIR PURCHASE FROM AMAZON. P.S. - how in the world was I supposed to be able to judge the flavor?
customer_reviews.author: ValleyIsleLaw

customer_reviews.title: Great dental treats
customer_reviews.text: These dental treats are a great way to help your dog with oral care. The treats come in several different sizes and also different quantities. We buy the bulk pack for medium size dogs. They com in several bags in a box. Open 1 bag at a time so you can preserve the freshness of the other treats. Our dog loves them and gets 1 every day after the evening meal. It acts like a toothbrush as his teeth are cleaned by the chewing action and his breath is left smelling good because of the ingredients use. Would highly recommend these dental treats.
customer_reviews.author: Rich W

customer_reviews.title: I wish the treats lasted longer
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, but I thought they would've lasted longer. I bought these because I wanted to give my dog something to keep him busy with for at least a few mins, but these treats were gone in under 30 seconds flat, and my dog is not an aggressive chewer at all. Oh well. They seemed to make his breath smell better, so that's good! Just don't buy them if you're hoping to use this as a "busy" type of treat for your pup. I didn't notice a huge difference in the cleanliness of his teeth, but then again, I only bought one bag.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE! These are NOT the same Greenies you buy in a pet store. These are expired and will make your dog sick. Gave my dog an upset stomach. The Greenies we buy in a pet store don’t upset her stomach. Throwing this box away.
customer_reviews.author: Daugherty

customer_reviews.title: Two happy customers
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect size for my two 35-lb dogs. I love greenies products but often find them to be a bit pricey at the pet store. Amazon always has these at a great price so I'll be purchasing them Here from now on.
customer_reviews.author: PeacockBlue11

customer_reviews.title: Nice chew. Buddy Enjoys very much.
customer_reviews.text: We have had a subscription to these treats for a while now. My dog Buddy who is about 55 lbs and a lab retriever mix is not usually a picky eater but he prefers chews and softer treats to biscuits. He does enjoy these treats and the larger quantity boxes are better value for the money. We try to give him a chewy once a day or once every other day to help with teeth cleaning. He chews through these in about 30 seconds with the regular size. They have always been pretty good in quality and they dont have a bad smell. They are a nice treat for him and he likes them everytime.
customer_reviews.author: GwendolynH

customer_reviews.title: Keeps My Dog's Teeth Sparkling White
customer_reviews.text: My dog has been eating a Greenie a day since I adopted her as a tiny 12-week-old pup. She's now 2.5 years old, and I constantly get compliments on how clean and white her teeth are! She has no surface stains on her teeth, and her breath always smells fresh and clean. Oh, and did I mention that she practically jumps in circles with excitement when I say "it's Greenie time!"? I will continue to give her a Greenie a day for the rest of her life to help her maintain excellent oral health!
customer_reviews.author: Charlene H

customer_reviews.title: Go to treat for my dogs.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these. I gave flavor a 5 star rating and I laughed as I did it because my dog will eat disgusting things. :) I feel like this product is highly overpriced. But I understand the supply and demand principles. Until I can not afford this luxury for my dogs they will get them.
customer_reviews.author: I Bought That?

customer_reviews.title: The dog LOVES these
customer_reviews.text: I keep these in a specific drawer and the second the dog sees me open this drawer, she gets that big stupid happy look on her face with her tongue hanging and she runs over with her tail spinning in circles so fast, she looks like she's going to take off like a helicopter. Sometimes if I give her a treat, she'll stash it somewhere for later, but these never last and she gobbles them up right away. She LOVES these things and I'll just keep buying them for her because I love to make my furry friend that happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love these!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs are obsessed with these! All of them get excited when they even see me pick up the box. I have been giving these to them for regular treats for all of their lives. All of my dogs can eat these. I have a dog that has had major dental problems that resulted in him having teeth pulled and he can still chew these treats with no problems. I appreciate being able to give my dogs dental treats that they can enjoy so much. I would recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Serena Reed

customer_reviews.title: Probably don't work, but dog loves them.
customer_reviews.text: Dunno if these clean teeth. I imagine combined with regular brushing and cleanings it would be beneficial. Then again, brushing and cleanings would probably by adequate by themselves. When I look at his teeth they're not really clean and he's been eating these since he was a puppy. He's one year old now, so any tartar or plaque buildup happened while these were on the job. That being said, my dog loves these and I don't have time to brush his teeth or money to get them cleaned. So for now, these are going to have to suffice. And he loves them, which is why they get four stars.
customer_reviews.author: Colette

customer_reviews.title: SCAM!! DO NOT BUY THESE "GREENIES"
customer_reviews.text: Made my dog extremely sick and caused frequent diarrhea. These are either fake or expired!!! All of the 5 stars you see are a SCAM. It also took two months to get these death sticks.
customer_reviews.author: Justine Tobias

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but pricey
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my cocker spaniel for the health of his teeth. He loves them, and they seem to be helping. I bought the regular 36 count on Dec .2 of this year for $23.79. I am reordering, but the price is now $33.99. That is a huge jump in price. I will look around for a better price next time. It is a great product, but I give him one every evening. $34.00 a month is a bit steep for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Bryant

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love these
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! A+++ transaction. super fast ship by seller. Packages received in excellent shape. Recommend seller. Thanks. Greenies have been a staple in my house since they were first sold. All the dogs we've had love them. I did a price comparison first with several sellers on Amazon and other merchants. This purchase was an excellent price for the number of greenies received. Hopefully they will continue to be stocked for purchase again when more are needed.
customer_reviews.author: MARY E LEPAGE

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love them; no noticeable dental/breath improvement
customer_reviews.text: My three dogs love Greenies. If I walk toward the treat bar, they get excited (I do have other treats there, but they are never disappointed when I give them a Greenie. Note: I had a golden retriever that did not like Greenies, so they are not for every dog, but for me, 3 out of 4 do. I have not noticed any real improvement with their breath or dental hygiene. I actually had better results when I used actual bones, but since they like them, I’ll keep buying them.
customer_reviews.author: JaneneR

customer_reviews.title: caution!
customer_reviews.text: Sadly my dog had her first greenie and threw it up within hours! She has had many types of tooth cleaners and breatsh fresheners, but never to vomit soon after ingesting! Was it indeed a bad batch, albeit not outdated, or what? Not a returnable item, either!
customer_reviews.author: KA

customer_reviews.title: they are OK but we stopped using it.
customer_reviews.text: These are just like "mints" for your dog. The dog loves it, but I don't think it does absolutely nothing for you dog oral hygiene. My dogs mouth smells good for some minutes and she loves it but ... thats it. It won't make her healthier. If you can get your dog to bite one of those "deer antlers" that would be the best... my dog doesn't like those, but I have seen the differences in other dogs... they really "brush" their teeth with those thins. 4 starts because it still works for getting good smell for some minutes. :) Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Greenies are the best! Price keeps fluctuating
customer_reviews.text: I got the idea to give our foster failure Greenies for her teeth from my uncle who gave his dog one per day until she passed. He called it her dollar a day habit. Now my dog is very happily carrying on the family tradition. We give her one when we brush our teeth before bed/ to let her know its bed time at night. She can hardly wait. Our vet always compliments her teeth too! My only complaint is that I had signed up for one 36 treat bag per month 'subscribe and save' and it doesn't lock in the price when you subscribe! In December it was $19 and today its $33. What gives?
customer_reviews.author: Marissa T.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding price for an already great product
customer_reviews.text: If you use greenies, then you know these are excellent and work very well in keeping my dog’s teeth clean. I just want to mention that the pricing on this box is outstanding. You’re not going to find a better price anywhere in my opinion. Are used to get them from one of those online pet supply places that ship things automatically at intervals but no more. Now I’m going to have Amazon ship it to me at intervals on subscribe and save instead.
customer_reviews.author: L. Premo

customer_reviews.title: Great chews!!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 2 year old Keeshond and a 13 year old English Setter and the both love Greenies! The younger dog will chew his Greenie in moments, and the older takes a little longer. When I ask them if they want a Greenie, they both look with excited anticipation! They know what they are and they love them! Having a dog with a sensitive tummy, these have not been an issue and I feel comfortable giving him the Greenie a few times a week. He really enjoys them.
customer_reviews.author: SusanManke

customer_reviews.title: The trick is feed this when dogs are not too hungry to chew.
customer_reviews.text: At the first time I just fed this as a treat for my husky, but instead of chewing, she was too hungry and gulped the whole. Thus I really doubt this will work, since the dental chew barely touches a fast eater's gum or teeth. Yesterday I found the trick. After fed her I gave her the treat, she will patiently chew for a while, so this will work! I will just wait for the long term result for teeth cleaning part.
customer_reviews.author: D. Li

customer_reviews.title: Upsets dogs stomach
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a 3yo pit lab mix and these treats made him really sick. At first I thought it was just some table scraps he ate but then after being well again he had another one of these and got sick again. He has never pooped in our house before. We just spent 6K on new carpet and he had explosive diarrhea and puked on it, and our couch. He also had blood in his poop. Luckily he is doing good now and I will be returning these treats.
customer_reviews.author: Briana

customer_reviews.title: Great product but pricey
customer_reviews.text: My dogs absolutely LOVE these treats! By far the treat they get most excited about. I believe it does help keep their gums clean too. We adopted a dog that had a lot of plaque built up and the plaque has decreased since giving him greenies. My only issue with these treats is the price....sure does add up quick between our two dogs. We recently started experimenting with a cheaper alternative that seems to work just as well.
customer_reviews.author: ms

customer_reviews.title: Good for humans too!
customer_reviews.text: My dog liked these so much I decided to give these a try and boy are these good. And they really clean your teeth! I havent brushed in 4 months after using greenies twice a day and I just went to visit my dentist, he told me that I have the cleanest teeth he has ever seen. I was embarressed to tell him my secret but the world has got to know, greenies are one of the best way to clean teeth!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Addict

customer_reviews.title: NOT SAFE FOR MANY DOGS TO EAT!!!
customer_reviews.text: These almost killed my dog, causing major digestion and bowel issues. These are basically treats that are not digestible. Not that way with all dogs but beware of the risk. I will never buy these for my dog. Never had this problem with Dentastix.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: These made my dog sick
customer_reviews.text: I fed these to three dogs and later that day they were all grazing on the grass (not usual for them). The big dog must have swallowed a bit and he started throwing up. He was sick for about 24 hours. I am returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Sessums Clan

customer_reviews.title: My GSD got sick and vomit
customer_reviews.text: My dog went sick and vomit few minutes after eating it. Every time I gave it to him, he got sick afterward, and not eating the whole next day. He may have sensitive stomach....but I don't recommend to purchase a large quantity until make sure it fits your pet.
customer_reviews.author: Marwan

customer_reviews.title: Product was 3 months past expiration when received.
customer_reviews.text: This is not Greenies fault but rather Amazon's! Unfortunately I opened the product and thought it smelled weird but should have looked further at it. Product had expired on March 3rd and it is now June 8th. I just received it on May 25th. Unfortunately my puppy has already eaten 6 of them over the course of the week. She has had very loose stools, diarrhea, sluggish and generally not herself for the last 3 days. I just looked at date tonight as I have become more concerned with her wellness. Will be following up with Vet tomorrow. Please please please check your expiration dates.
customer_reviews.author: Annette Frawley

customer_reviews.title: Made my dog sick
customer_reviews.text: These "treats" made my dog sick. They are not easy to digest and create stool with a very gummy consistency which results in constipation and and digestive issues. I made sure to buy the right "size" for my dogs weight and only gave one treat a day as recommended. Please don't give these things to your dog...
customer_reviews.author: VINNY Z.

customer_reviews.title: she was fine. I spoke to a dog trainer with 20 ...
customer_reviews.text: NOT SAFE FOR DOGS! My dog would barely eat while using these over a period of months and as soon as I took her off them, she was fine. I spoke to a dog trainer with 20 years of experience who told me these are completely unsafe and undigestible for dogs.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves them
customer_reviews.text: Dog loves them. She doesn’t really have bad breath in the first place but still enjoys them as a treat. Our dog trainer said they’re not good for dogs, get lodged in their intestines and we should brush the dog’s teeth instead. Not sure how true that all is, but I don’t foresee brushing the dog’s teeth, so Greenies every other day it is!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Norton

customer_reviews.title: Great Excellent Amazing Tasty Dental Treat
customer_reviews.text: My dogs LOVE these!!! And they are picky when it comes to treats. Literally I will tell you want a greenie and my boxer mix comes running from across the yard in a full Sprint...just so you are aware...I will try to get her to come by calling Treats, Cheese, Bacon, Steak, Chicken, Ham everything I could think of and she wouldn't come until she heard GREENIE!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Mikels

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product & Value
customer_reviews.text: BEST DEAL OUT THERE. I scour the internet to find deals on these Greenies. I don't know how many of you research their prices. Greenies are a very expensive treat,tooth and breath cleaner. My dogs go bananas over them. As a side note, I would advise just one a day. This is the best price anywhere. Quickly take advantage of this deal and save yourself money and time surfing the web.
customer_reviews.author: tracy doyle

customer_reviews.title: I was a skeptic...
customer_reviews.text: I admit it. I thought it was all Madison Ave BS. NOTHING except brushing was going to clean my dog's breath! Then I tried these things. My dog had developed a massive bad breath issue. She smelled like she had eaten rotting fish on every exhale. Brushing didn't touch the smell. We gave her one a day for a week. WOW! Yay. These thing really do work. They aren't a replacement for cleanings and such, but they really seem to help keep their teeth cleaner and breath fresher.
customer_reviews.author: SciFiGuy

customer_reviews.title: Made our dog sick
customer_reviews.text: Our dog had violent diarrhea for several days after eating 1 Greenie. We were up all night with her. We didn't realize at first what caused the diarrhea and assumed she had somehow eaten some chocolate. So, once her diarrhea was resolved, we gave her another Greenie. She had diarrhea again lasting for over a day.
customer_reviews.author: Mila Gooberstein

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love them!
customer_reviews.text: One of our dogs spends time chewing them and the other one chomps it into a couple of pieces and swallows them. Because of that, I break them in two and give the thicker piece to the chewer and the smaller piece to the gulper. I'm not crazy about them but they sure are and God forbid I should forget their lunch-time snack! What we do for our dogs!
customer_reviews.author: Mandy G.

customer_reviews.title: Other Dogs are Green With Envy!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog was so excited on Christmas morning to open his present and find Greenies Dog Dental Chews Dog Treats! He immediately wolfed one down and then went outside to share his excitement with other dogs in the neighborhood. This made them green with envy. Howl their owners weren't smart enough to get them Greenies Dog Dental Chews Dog Treats, I will never know. All day long our dog begged for his Greenies without paws. Some of you readers will understand, yet others will think this review is a tall tail.
customer_reviews.author: I'm Right

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product but not a replacement for brushing
customer_reviews.text: My two dogs love these but I split them in half as I had one dog get a piece stuck going across her mouth. Luckily I was there watching her eat it and helped dislodge it. So DON'T feed and walk away. Also this product can't replace actually brushing their teeth. I do that first and use these as a treat for afterwards. I have a 13 year old that's never needed a vet cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: BuddyJ

customer_reviews.title: They aren't cheap versus other options
customer_reviews.text: The pooch loves Greenies but she eats almost anything and if I had to choose for something that lasts longer to knaw on and possibly keep teeth clean it is probably a rawhide or chewnola. The Greenies don't keep her occupied for long (but they aren't supposed to, I don't think). I don't know if they actually do anything for dental hygene either and are fairly expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Made a difference
customer_reviews.text: Both of my dogs liked them and they made a noticable difference in the buildup on our new dog's teeth. She had some pretty bad brownish-black buildup on her back teeth when we got her from the shelter, which was actually why I decided to try these. A little expensive but I got them around black Friday, so they were cheaper. I'll buy them again when I see them on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree P.

customer_reviews.title: Waiting for her dental chew!
customer_reviews.text: These chews are so anticipated by my dog, Penelope. She knows exactly when she is going to get one each day and will stand and stare at me until I follow through! They seem to be doing a wonderful job on her teeth - Penelope is 12 and at her last check up, the Vet commented that her teeth looked like those of a 3 year old. I highly recommend them as a wonderful aid in keeping your dog's teeth tip-top!
customer_reviews.author: Lpeck

customer_reviews.title: Dog Loves This!
customer_reviews.text: I've given my dogs Greenies for years, but sometimes try other "minty" treats for them. One of the dogs doesn't like the other ones and is very picky (he actually drops the other kind and looks at me like, "Where's the good stuff?"). It never fails, however, that when I give him a Greenie, he eats it up and loves it! Looks like I'll only be giving him authentic Greenies from now on. I have started a subscription through Amazon so they will be delivered automatically. Hooray for technology!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: My Dog Loves These
customer_reviews.text: My dog is 7 and I struggle to get a good brush on his teeth because he hates it. I give 1-3 of these a week to him and the vet says he has great dental health! I would like to think that these are helping. Even if they are not, my pup literally goes crazy for them. This was such a great Amazon day deal that I could not pass up. He is in stock for the rest of the year on these goodies.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia

customer_reviews.title: My dogs go crazy
customer_reviews.text: I've always gotten these from a pet store or chewy. Amazon has the best price for the regular 72 count. My dogs go crazy for these. They get 1 every night as their bedtime treats!! I go through a box almost every month, if i run out before I order next my dogs know it and will not come near me until they get their greenies!!
customer_reviews.author: darkhate668

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive, didn't do much.
customer_reviews.text: This product was ok, but did not make a big difference in the bad breath my dogs tend to have. It's an ok product because it probably is better for them to have than nothing at all. I give 2 stars instead of 3 solely because I subscribed and saved this product to be delivered every month, and after 2 deliveries the price increased $10! Thank goodness Amazon notified me about it, because now this product is completely not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brendon

customer_reviews.title: Crack Cocaine for dogs
customer_reviews.text: When I ask my American Eskie if he wants a “treat” he sits and wags his tail...when I ask him if he wants a “Greenie” he literally starts trembling and starts doing tricks! It took him approximately 3 greenies for him to learn that word. The way he eats these things, I’m going to go into debt fairly soon.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne in Jersey

customer_reviews.title: Please don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: These get a good rap but please do your research on greenies before you buy. They were recalled for not being digestible... which now they have claimed to fix. But my dog throws them up everything I would give him one!! Do not buy please. Buy “Get Naked” dog chews. Cleanse they’re teeth... and they’re healthy!!! And way cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Our Dog LOVES these, but not sure how much they clean her teeth.
customer_reviews.text: This is probably our dogs favorite treat! I'm not sure how much it really does for her teeth though. We've given her real beef bones and it whitens her teeth right up and makes her breath better. However, she LOVES these, so we have them on subscription and she gets one a day. Use this as a reward if you really want eye contact, and for them to work hard and pay attention!
customer_reviews.author: GJ

customer_reviews.title: Dogs first choice snack
customer_reviews.text: Basing this on my Dogs reaction. She's a 50 pound, 13 year old and loves these things. We give her one a day and her Dental health is good for her age. They're soft enough to clean but not too soft. We tried to switch to a cheaper Costco brand but they were so hard we were afraid she'd break her teeth. These are our dogs 1st choice!
customer_reviews.author: Robin Richie

customer_reviews.title: Lukey Likey a lot
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs favorite treat! I'd say he gets just as excited for a Greenie as he does when anything has peanut butter on it, which is really saying a lot for dogs (and ours specifically). I saw some reviews about receiving expired treats or treats with stuff growing in the box but we order these pretty regularly and have never had a date that was close to expiration.
customer_reviews.author: Craig SullivanTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Explosive Diarrhea!!!
customer_reviews.text: These gave my doberman explosive diarrhea about an hour after he ate them. I waited a week to try again just in case it was a fluke. SAME RESULT. I cannot recommend these and Amazon would not let me return them.
customer_reviews.author: Ahkibah

customer_reviews.title: A Reliable Product!
customer_reviews.text: I have to be so careful with these treats because my dogs LOVE them and will snag them if given the opportunity! Especially my Whippet! The only negative is that sometimes these treats leave a residue where the dog chewed them. By no means is it hard to clean, but its a little frustrating and inconvenient. However, that doesn't take away from the positives! 1) My dogs treat them the same as some of the more expensive treats (no grain, no additives, etc.) that I have. 2) They really do help with doggy breath. 3) They do help with tarter. 4) They don't smell bad (I hate treats that leave my fingers smelling terrible).
customer_reviews.author: crystal

customer_reviews.title: My Dogs Want Their Midnight Greenies Snack!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs, all rescues and some Service Dogs, LOVE these as much as a training reward. Not only the scent but the texture. My pups come to attention very quickly when I even go near the box. They KNOW. The bonus that it's good for their teeth is great. I even use these to teach them to SEARCH and they are Highly Motivated and always find them. My Yellow Lab, Black Flat Head Retriever and GSD wait patiently for their Greenies at midnight. I've been buying them continously for over a decade. There should be a frequent buyer program from Nutro.
customer_reviews.author: @BaileyMcGreggor

customer_reviews.title: Doggo loves them
customer_reviews.text: My 50lb lab mix loves these! He tends to have messy teeth, so his vet recommended a dental chew. He's been having a greenie a day for about 3 months now, and his teeth are staying cleaner than they ever have. On top of the dental benefits, he loves the taste. He makes sure we don't forget to give him his greenie before we leave for work in the morning! I'm very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: A.T.

customer_reviews.title: If the dog is happy, we're happy
customer_reviews.text: Our 50 lb German Shorthaired Pointer loves her greenies! They're gone in about 2 minutes after she gets one which is typically every other day. I didn't do a before and after of her teeth to see if it's actually cleaning them but she enjoys them. I've seen them recommended by veterinarians so yeah if she's happy, we're happy.
customer_reviews.author: MDR

customer_reviews.title: Doggie Crack!
customer_reviews.text: My dog LOVES these things. He has a morning routine and it includes getting a greenie. God help me on the mornings when we’re out or I forget. He’ll remind me by whining and following me around the house until I “remember” or drive to the store to get more. Usually find the best pricing online, although some brick & moarters will price match. Amazon runs specials from time to time. It’s best to stock up then if you can.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra_Hiker

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love them
customer_reviews.text: My Boxers get a Greenie every night, and they drive me crazy until they get it. Their teeth seem to stay very nice, and strong and clean, so (knock on wood) no problem with dental. I have been giving ALL my dogs Greenies, daily over the years and will continue, because they seem to be good of their health.
customer_reviews.author: run2it

customer_reviews.title: Fresh breath a treat for both of us
customer_reviews.text: My Australian Labradoodle loves these. I can’t speak to the nutritional value, but it doesn’t make my dog sick or make her poo. She runs around trying to find a place to hide it, crying in joy, but doesn’t want to hide it because she wants to eat it. Supposedly good for their teeth. It freshens her breath, especially after eating from the litter box. One a day keeps the stink breath away.... the teenies are good Maltese little dog size, I get the regular for my 35lb doodle.
customer_reviews.author: KrisR33

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love these!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs know when I say "let's go brush your teeth" that they are receiving a Greenie. Must taste good because they can't wait to get one, and I love them as they help keep my dogs teeth healthy. Amazon has these for a great price, as I would pay alot more in Petco or some other store.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Dogs LOVE them
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs LOVE them. We literally can't say the word "greenies" or they go crazy and run to the kitchen where we keep them. 4 stars only because I'm not sure how much they actually help. We usually give them to the pups a couple times a week (so not every day), and they still get tarter build up and have bad breath. They're also pricey. But our dogs love them, so it's worth it to keep getting them to make them happy.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Gave the dog green diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for an elderly rescue with foul breath. It gave her green diarrhea. Never again. I should have checked the ingredient list, but I don’t see it listed.
customer_reviews.author: karls

customer_reviews.title: Top 2 of of my dog treats
customer_reviews.text: My labradors prefer these against some of the other treats that resemble jerky, meat or pork ect. After giving them a dental chew they run to diferent corners of the room and watch each other chew. I have to keep an assortment of treats for their digestion, health and training and these are right up at the top for dental care.
customer_reviews.author: Batch

customer_reviews.title: My Puppy doe not like these treats
customer_reviews.text: My 4 month-old standard poodle does not want to have anything to do with these treats. Accordingly, I purchased other similar dental treats (at local pet stores). Interestingly, he has liked all other dental treats I have purchased for him, except these. Moreover, he is a puppy that chews everything he can get his paws on except these treats.
customer_reviews.author: Janet B.

customer_reviews.title: Beware!! May give your dog an upset stomach!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly... the minute I gave one of these my dog has been having the worst stomach ache and ugly, smelly, green diarrhea I’ve ever seen. I haven’t introduced anything else new to his diet and it’s obvious this is causing it because his poop is literally the color of the greenie. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: vicente sanchez

customer_reviews.title: These work extremely well
customer_reviews.text: I recommend these extremely highly. Having clean teeth will prolong your dogs life. It will also save you the very high cost of dental care for your dog. They are not inexpensive, but in the big picture they are certainly worth it. My Chihuahuas and Chug's really love the taste.
customer_reviews.author: QuinnTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: She loves these & they DO help clean her teeth
customer_reviews.text: Our dog begs for the Original version of these. Not so with other dental treats, including the new version or anything else that is hard to chew. These DO clean - not perfectly clean, but her breath definitely improved. I could see white on her teeth improve on the top half of her teeth. They did a good enough job that I have added them to Subscribe and Save. That also says a lot because they are expensive! She did NOT like the "new and improved" version of these. I won't buy these if and when they run out of the Original version.
customer_reviews.author: TheBlogittyShnoog©Review

customer_reviews.title: Questionable quality of the box I received
customer_reviews.text: My dog got very sick shortly after eating one. She’d eaten them before so I’m not sure what was wrong with the box I ordered. However I did get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crack for my dogs
customer_reviews.text: My dogs absolutely love these things. They hear me open them at night and are on me like crack heads. They go nuts for these. The shipment was quick and product was great. Came as described. Keeps my dogs teeth clean and breath fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Joey L

customer_reviews.title: My dog barks for this treat every day!
customer_reviews.text: This has been my dog favorite treat since he was a puppy. And it cleans my dog's teeth, freshen his breath. My friend even was surprised to see all my dog's teeth are white. Guess how much I spent on vet teeth cleaning? ZERO. All thanks to this dental treats!
customer_reviews.author: Bin

customer_reviews.title: Both Dogs Love These
customer_reviews.text: Both our dogs love these things and their breaths are certainly fresher. Our vet told me these do help control tarter buildup, and these latest formula Greenies are way more easily digested. Price for the larger quantities is very good also.
customer_reviews.author: Deano48

customer_reviews.title: Granddog's birthday success!
customer_reviews.text: These arrived on the day promised and my son's dog was very pleased with them. It gives dogs better breath too.
customer_reviews.author: Caseeih

customer_reviews.title: My dogs loving the greenies
customer_reviews.text: My dogs 💚this greenies so much. They are addicting with this. I tried different brand but it seems like not liking the other brand I bought for them. In almost 9 years we have our dogs the greenies is number for them they have it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Pure

customer_reviews.title: The favorite treat for our girl
customer_reviews.text: Our Border Collie loves her daily Greenie! Every evening she gets one, after we eat dinner and watch the news, and she is always ready for her daily treat. She even herds us to the kitchen to get her daily treat, always eating it brush side first, the look on her face tells you she is happy. It freshens her breath and keeps her happy, what more could I want?
customer_reviews.author: Eric Gates

customer_reviews.title: I like that there are two separate resealable bags to help ...
customer_reviews.text: Pup loves these, though I don't know that he is chewing them the way they are meant to be chewed. He is a 55-pound dobie mix and will finish a regular size greenie in about a minute. The firm yet bendy texture of these always weirds me out but he likes them and they agree with his stomach. I like that there are two separate resealable bags to help with freshness.
customer_reviews.author: MroTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great white teeth.
customer_reviews.text: This came in good condition. My dog loves these. The fact it was made in the USA was one of the reasons I purchased this product. I have a old labordoodle, he really likes them. He gets one every night after brushing his teeth. Is eight years old and has bright white teeth. The the first box I got, I did not store them right and had to throw them out. Keep them in a cold dry place and they will last better. I live in Panama.
customer_reviews.author: Joey's mum

customer_reviews.title: I haven't seen long term results
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Price on amazon is cheaper than other sites and stores. CONS: Freshens breath but only momentarily. Even after 3 months of using this product on a daily basis, visits to the vet still indicate she has tartar build-up or needs dental work. Mind you, I started her on Greenies right after her teeth were cleaned. I'm thinking of switching to the Kirkland brand and just giving her a bone to chew on.
customer_reviews.author: Lena's Mum

customer_reviews.title: I have used Greenies for years
customer_reviews.text: Have used for adult dogs and it seems to help retard tarter buildup. Now using on Chessie pup, currently five months old. I break the treat into two pieces so this big pup can handle it plus use it as a reward to 'KENNEL" command. He loves to chew these up. Second set of teeth coming in and they are amazingly white!
customer_reviews.author: Irving D Hill

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love them.
customer_reviews.text: I stopped giving my dogs rawhide, because they'd swallow them whole. Never had to brush dogs teeth. then after years of no rawhide, my dog had bad teeth and had to have some removed. Vet recommended these, the dogs love them and no more problems with their teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi O

customer_reviews.title: Great for their teeth, guilt free snacking
customer_reviews.text: These chews are great, in my dog's own opinion. She goes crazy for them, following me around the house and howling until she gets one. I like that they're approved by VOHC (Veterinary Oral Health Council) to be effective in fighting plaque. However, Greenies can't do it alone. Add toothbrushing daily with Virbac toothpaste and adding Fresh Pet breath freshener to their water and you can keep that "dog breath" away. Don't forget to get their teeth cleaned at the vet, too. Prevention will save you thousands down the line.
customer_reviews.author: Meta

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love these!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs like these so much that one of them will reject a dry bone after these are gone. He's looking for a Greenie because he absolutely loves them. I know I'm giving them something that is good for them and they know what they are getting when I say "who wants a Greenie?" It's so cute.
customer_reviews.author: Susan L. Weakland

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful toothcleaning and a treat at the same time!
customer_reviews.text: Dental care is very important for dogs. Not only is the protein good in these chews but they are recommended by the veterinary oral health council. I give my dog one a day. It is much cheaper than having his teeth cleaned and a treat also for him.
customer_reviews.author: penny bowers

product_meta.title: Greenies Original Regular Natural Dental Dog Treats (25 - 50lb. dogs)
product_meta.description: Size:36 TreatsOne GREENIES Original Dental Treat a day is all it takes for clean teeth, fresh breath, and a happy dog. Your dog can't wait to sink their teeth into these delicious, original-flavor dental dog breath chews because they feature a delightfully chewy texture that fights plaque and tartar. Irresistibly tasty and incredibly powerful, GREENIES Treats for Dogs are vet-recommended for at-home oral health care. Best of all, these natural dog breath treats are made with highly soluble ingredients that are safe and easy to digest. Give your dog the mouth-wowing treat that helps promote their overall health with GREENIES Dog Treats. Natural Dog Treats Plus Vitamins, Minerals, and Other Nutrients.
feature_bullets: Contains one (1) 36 oz. 36-count pack of Greenies Original Regular Size Natural Dental Dog Treats; Natural Dog Treats Plus Vitamins, Minerals and Other Nutrients
The unique texture of Greenies Dog Chews cleans down to the gumline to fight plaque and tartar and freshen bad dog breath
Greenies Treats for Dogs are veterinarian recommended and VOHC accepted (Veterinary Oral Health Council)
Treat your dog fantastically with the great taste of Greenies Original Dental Treats.Calorie Content:3,119 kcal/kg, 90 kcal/treat ME (calculated)
Greenies Dog Treats are made with natural, easy-to-digest ingredients and are nutritionally complete
